As we all continue to follow the guidelines to stay safe and healthy, we wonder what we can do to help others in our greater Charlotte community. We have all been hearing about the lack of personal protective equipment (PPE) for our brave healthcare workers. Designated Goodwill stores (see below for locations and times) are accepting and distributing donations of handmade (see below on how to make) and surgical masks, and latex free gloves to our local hospitals. Here's what you need to know:
The following Goodwill locations are accepting items on Thursdays and Saturdays from 12:00 to 4:00 pm:
https://goodwillsp.org/shop/retail-stores/ballantyne/
https://goodwillsp.org/shop/retail-stores/second-editions/
How to make masks:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BVLgfH8MG18 (no sew)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zm_NmpdgWWA (sewing machine)
We truly are all in this together! Keep staying safe and healthy, SA!
